newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China to pay McDonald's to shut its store - HK paper.
newsitem.headline: China to pay McDonald's to shut its store - HK paper.

text.p: China has argeed to pay McDonald's Corp. 100 million yuan in compensation for closing its flagship store in Beijing to make way for a shopping plaza, a Hong Kong newspaper said on Wednesday.

The Hong Kong Economic Times quoted Beijing vice-mayor Zhang Baifa as saying the city government had no problem with McDonald's demand for 100 million yuan in compensation and negotiations were progressing smoothly.
The report did not say if the compensation had been paid.
McDonald's has agreed to move the restaurant, its first in China, to make way for a commercial and shopping complex to be built by Hong Kong's Cheung Kong (Holdings) Ltd.
The U.S. fast food giant has more than 100 restaurants in 15 cities throughout China.
